description: This is perfect

i find it very appealing for the reason that in windows it never ships with a native pdf viewer and relies on browsers
But really. Simple, effective, great shortkeys.

Well, I will make it clear that it is not incapable of opening documents. However, this in itself is not hard to achieve. The thing I find very, very frustrating is the fact that every time a file is opened the window is tiny, and I must move the mouse all the way over and maximize it. This problem may seem meaningless for some, however, if you have thousands of PDF files and the VAST majority of them aren't named in such a way that the contents can be ascertained without opening the document, this "little" issue, requiring up to half of the total time it takes to quickly open, identify, and close a document, adds up to a not insignificant amount of pointless work and makes finishing the task significantly slower.
When something isn't ideal but the required change would not be straightforeward for the developers to impliment, then it isn't frustrating. But this is a clear case where an important feature in a simple piece of software is arbitrarily missing, that is pretty annoying.
summary: Every document opened must enlarge the window to make readable

It's an okay piece of software. Best part is smooth scrolling when using touchpads. However, evince lacks a couple features that would incline me to use it more.
For annotations, it does not support free-hand annotations (e.g. being able to annotate a graph in a paper), signatures, or in-line notes.
Additionally, evince does not save over a PDF file, only repeatedly asks to save a copy, which can be quite annoying when making multiple annotations to PDF.

Adding more annotation options and the ability to save-over the original PDF would fully round out evince's feature set!

description: Läuft seit Jahren auf unterschiedlichen Rechnern sehr verlässlich

Funktioniert als PDF-Betrachter sehr gut und zuverlässig. Ist nicht so leichtgewichtig wie andere PDF-Apps, hat dafür aber ein paar schöne Features und ein sehr gelungenes Design. Pluspunkt für die Erweiterungen, mtit denen man ePS, DejaVu etc. nachrüsten kann.
Leider ist der Umgang mit und die Darstellung von Kommentaren nicht so elegant wie bei Okular oder Acrobat Reader. Wie die meisten freien PDF-Reader kann man PDF-Dateien mit Evince nicht trivial unterschreiben, das ist heutzutage nicht toll. Auch die eingebetteten Tools/Macros, die manche Acrobat-Workflows haben, funktionieren mit Evince nicht.
Evince ist vielleicht nicht besonders effizient zu bedienen, aber es kann trotzdem alles, was ich von einem PDF-Betrachter erwarten würde und es sieht sehr schick aus.
